module.name: product_structure_and_classification
module.keywords: module, individual, class, product, library, structure, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record:

ul.li: individual products with their whole-part, connection, containment and involvement in connection relationships;
a library of classes of product with their whole-part, connection, containment and involvement in connection relationships;
the classification of an individual product as a member of a class of product, and the classification of a relationship between individual products as a member of a class of relationship; and
the specification of the complete membership for a class of product or a class of relationship between products.

li.p: the existence of an individual product;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_product_structure application module.

li.p: a whole-part relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_product_structure application module.

li.p: a connection relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_product_structure application module.

li.p: a containment relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_product_structure application module.

li.p: an involvement of a individual product in a connection between individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Individual_product_structure application module.

li.p: the existence of a class of product;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a whole-part relationship between two individual products;
li.note: A mapping between classes of product is a class that has relationships between individual products as members.
This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a connection relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a containment relationship between two individual products;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.
This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.

li.p: set theory relationships, such as subset, union and intersection, between classes of product and between mappings;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Class_of_product_library application module.

li.p: the classification of an individual product as a member of a class of product;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to the classification of products is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: the classification of a relationship between individual products as a member of a mapping;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to the classification of products is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: the specification of the complete membership of a class of product or of a mapping between classes of product;
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced Classification application module. The application of the capability to the classification of products is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

li.p: reference to an externally defined class of product or product relationship.
li.note: This capability is provided by the referenced External_item_identification_assignment application module. The application of the capability to classes of activity or relationships between classes of activity is specified by this part of ISO 10303.

note.p: Activity structure and classification is within the scope of the Activity_structure_and_classification application module.
The assignment of a property is within the scope of the Property_and_property_assignment application module.

uof.name: product_structure_and_classification
uof.description: The product_structure_and_classification UOF provides the ability to record information about classes of product and individual products, their structure, and classification relationships between classes and individuals.
